title.value: Computing equilibria for integer programming games
title.justification: The title 'Computing equilibria for integer programming games' accurately reflects the core research focus presented in the paper.
title.quote: Computing equilibria for integer programming games

extractions.description: This paper explores the computational complexity of determining the existence of a Nash equilibrium in integer programming games (IPGs) and develops algorithms to compute equilibria for such games. It also analyzes the performance of these methods on various game scenarios like knapsack and kidney exchange games.

type.justification: The paper is theoretical as it focuses on computational complexity and algorithm development for solving equilibria in integer programming games.
type.quote: In this paper, we start by showing the computational complexity of deciding the existence of a Nash equilibrium for an IPG.

name.justification: The paper is focused on algorithmic applications in game theory, particularly on computing equilibria such as Nash equilibria in integer programming games.
name.quote: Nash equilibria have been widely accepted as the solution concept of a game...

name.justification: The paper is listed under the 'Discrete Optimization' section, indicating its relevance to this field.
The paper discusses integer programming games extensively, making it a subfield of focus.
